reviews.review_msg: She is a great prof! If you need to take a course with her, do it and you won't regret it. She is super interested in the course and improving the students' writing and skills. Her teaching is clear and questions are encouraged. She usually scales exams quite generously.

Great prof. Our class had 16 people in it, and she made the effort to make sure we all understood the material. She is very nice and can always explain the material to you in a different way if needed. The assignments and exams are on the difficult side, but she scales, ALOT. I highly recommend taking courses with her!

She is a great prof. She seems very interested in the material she teaches and makes sure the students understand what she is talking about. Totally ask questions whenever you don't get something. Homework is fair, the exams were difficult. Grading is fair.

He starts by covering group actions first, and then doing everything in terms of group actions. Note that most commonly, group actions are NOT taught until the Sylow theorems, which is an advanced topic covered much later. In the interest of "elegance", HE MAKES THINGS NEEDLESSLY HARD. At least he is approachable.

Has a very fun style of teaching and is a really nice/passionate dude. Assignments were pretty easy (at least relative to other upper-division math courses) and he does a pretty good job keeping everyone engaged with his lectures.

Although Professor Rattan is new to the school and was the first time he taught 341 here, he still did a great job. Gave really clear lectures and cared about how each student was doing in the course. Assignments were sometimes challenging but related. Midterm was a bit too long, but he made up for it on the final. A really talented teacher.

This class is a very difficult course, but Nils makes it slightly better. His lectures are passionate and insightful. The homework assignments are fairly long, and the TA (Haggai) is an incredibly harsh marker. Overall wonderful professor, very warm and friendly, and always willing to help out with questions after/before class or in office hours.
